PowerShell execution policies are security measures that control how scripts run on a system. They help prevent unauthorized or malicious scripts from executing. However, they are not a security featureâ€”they are a safety measure designed to prevent accidental script execution rather than block malicious code.

By default, execution policies are set to:

  • Restricted on Windows client systems (no scripts allowed)
  • RemoteSigned on Windows Server systems (scripts need a signature if downloaded)
